result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna J Golownia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs/fine shall be paid as a condition of probation in 14CF136.  Court orders judgment for nonpayment.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anna J Golownia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State indicates the defendant has paid restitution up front.  Court imposes a fine of $579.00 (DNA) to be paid during probation in 14CF136 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  State notes that restitution has been paid up front and recommend fine of $579.00 (DNA) and DNA sample.  State request adjournment for compliance with victim rights.  Defendant will be in custody until November 12, 2015 and then probation thereafter for 2 years.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
No contact with After Hours Lingerie & Gifts store

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred deJunco State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant will retain counsel.  State indicates the defendant is serving a sanction and do not oppose a signature bond, Court orders $150.00 signature bond.  Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 09:45 am.
